TEXT: The applicant , Mr ORG , is a NORP citizen , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . The respondent Government are represented by their Agent Ms Lidija PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the applicant drove a vehicle from GPE to GPE , without passing through any customs checkpoint at the border . On DATE ORG FAC uprava varaždinska ) seized the applicant ’s vehicle .

Subsequently the applicant was charged with an attempt to smuggle the vehicle into GPE contrary to LAW ( PERSON ) . On DATE ORG ( ORG za carinske prekršaje PERSON ) found the applicant guilty of a customs offence and fined him CARDINAL NORP kunas ( HRK ) . The fine was to be replaced by a prison term if the applicant did not pay it . Moreover , the applicant ’s vehicle was confiscated .
The applicant appealed against the decision stating that he had not had any intention to smuggle the vehicle to GPE , but that he had been lost and therefore missed the border checkpoint .
On DATE ORG ( ORG za carinske prekršaje u drugom stupnju carinske uprave PERSON ) upheld the first instance decision .
On DATE the applicant , represented by a counsel , instituted proceedings in ORG ( ORG ) claiming that the lower administrative bodies had wrongly assessed the facts .

The facts related to the subsequent proceedings are in dispute . According to the Government , on DATE the applicant ’s claim was rejected by ORG . The judgment was served on the applicant ’s counsel on CARDINAL DATE . In support of ORG have submitted a copy of ORG judgment of CARDINAL DATE and a copy of a receipt slip of an envelope addressed to the applicant ’s counsel indicating that it contained a copy of the said judgment . The receipt slip was signed by an illegible name on DATE . It was also stamped by ORG on DATE thus indicating that the signed receipt slip was returned to the court on DATE .

According to the applicant , on DATE , DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE he asked ORG to speed up the proceedings . He maintains that no judgment upon his claim before ORG has ever been served either on him or his counsel . As to the receipt slip submitted by the ORG the applicant alleges that it was signed by an unknown person .
